rows.story_text:
Chat was born blind.

Her eyes had never seen her parents, or her brother and sisters. She knew their faces by touch.

story_text.eng:
Chat was born blind.

Her eyes had never seen her parents, or her brother and sisters. She knew their faces by touch.

annotation_1.eng: Have you tried walking with your eyes closed? If you do, be sure to be with someone else to stay safe.

annotation_2.eng: When you don't see, you become much more aware of your other senses. Which senses do you notice more when you close your eyes?

annotation_3.eng: A rectangle is a four-sided shape like this page. A square is a rectangle with four equal sides. Point to the squares and rectangles you see on this page.

rows.annotation_1: Have you tried walking with your eyes closed? If you do, be sure to be with someone else to stay safe.
rows.annotation_2: When you don't see, you become much more aware of your other senses. Which senses do you notice more when you close your eyes?
rows.annotation_3: A rectangle is a four-sided shape like this page. A square is a rectangle with four equal sides. Point to the squares and rectangles you see on this page.

rows.story_text:
One day, Chat was strolling in the garden.

She liked the sweet scent of flowers.

She loved to touch their soft petals.

story_text.eng:
One day, Chat was strolling in the garden.

She liked the sweet scent of flowers.

She loved to touch their soft petals.

annotation_1.eng: There are many things to count here. Count together the trees, butterflies, canes, shoes, and any other groups you notice.

annotation_2.eng: Which of these groups can Chat count?

annotation_3.eng: Which of these groups has the most in it and which has the least?

rows.annotation_1: There are many things to count here. Count together the trees, butterflies, canes, shoes, and any other groups you notice.
rows.annotation_2: Which of these groups can Chat count?
rows.annotation_3: Which of these groups has the most in it and which has the least?

rows.story_text:
Chat wished she could see flowers, just once.

"They are lovely," she said to herself.

story_text.eng:
Chat wished she could see flowers, just once.

"They are lovely," she said to herself.

annotation_1.eng: There are five blue flowers and five yellow-orange flowers. How many is that all together?

annotation_2.eng: If you include the yellow-orange flower that Chat is holding, that would be one more. What is one more than five?

annotation_3.eng: How many more blue flowers are there than butterflies?

rows.annotation_1: There are five blue flowers and five yellow-orange flowers. How many is that all together?
rows.annotation_2: If you include the yellow-orange flower that Chat is holding, that would be one more. What is one more than five?
rows.annotation_3: How many more blue flowers are there than butterflies?

rows.story_text:
Every day, Chat walked in the garden. She knew her way around.

Today, she raised her head to the skies.

story_text.eng:
Every day, Chat walked in the garden. She knew her way around.

Today, she raised her head to the skies.

annotation_1.eng: Do you see the surprise on her face? What is she surprised about?

annotation_2.eng: She can't see the clouds. What can she sense about what is happening?

annotation_3.eng: What is going on in the sky? What do you think is about to happen?

rows.annotation_1: Do you see the surprise on her face? What is she surprised about?
rows.annotation_2: She can't see the clouds. What can she sense about what is happening?
rows.annotation_3: What is going on in the sky? What do you think is about to happen?

rows.story_text:
Suddenly, she heard thunder and lightning.

"I need to hurry back to the house," Chat thought.

story_text.eng:
Suddenly, she heard thunder and lightning.

"I need to hurry back to the house," Chat thought.

annotation_1.eng: Have you ever been outside someplace when a storm came up quickly? Did you get wet?

annotation_3.eng: Do you find lightning scary or fun when you are outside?

rows.annotation_1: Have you ever been outside someplace when a storm came up quickly? Did you get wet?
rows.annotation_3: Do you find lightning scary or fun when you are outside?

rows.story_text:
Rain began to fall.

Chat slipped, lost her balance and fell.

She hit her head on a stone.

story_text.eng:
Rain began to fall.

Chat slipped, lost her balance and fell.

She hit her head on a stone.

annotation_1.eng: Head injuries can be very serious. Do you think Chat will be okay?

annotation_2.eng: There are colors going from yellow to light red to red in this picture. Point to them and describe them.

annotation_3.eng: Point to and describe the colors going from yellow to various greens in the picture.

rows.annotation_1: Head injuries can be very serious. Do you think Chat will be okay?
rows.annotation_2: There are colors going from yellow to light red to red in this picture. Point to them and describe them.
rows.annotation_3: Point to and describe the colors going from yellow to various greens in the picture.

rows.story_text:
When Chat woke up, there were people around her.

"What happened?" she asked.

story_text.eng:
When Chat woke up, there were people around her.

"What happened?" she asked.

annotation_1.eng: Count together the people in Chat's family. Did you include Chat?

annotation_2.eng: Can you tell by looking at their faces what each person is feeling?

annotation_3.eng: There are many colors here! Which of the colors of the rainbow are missing in this picture?

rows.annotation_1: Count together the people in Chat's family. Did you include Chat?
rows.annotation_2: Can you tell by looking at their faces what each person is feeling?
rows.annotation_3: There are many colors here! Which of the colors of the rainbow are missing in this picture?

rows.story_text:
You fell and bumped your head, her father said.

"We are so thankful that you are fine," said her mother.

story_text.eng:
You fell and bumped your head, her father said.

"We are so thankful that you are fine," said her mother.

annotation_1.eng: There is a fun circular pattern on Chat's bed. Are there more blue circles or red circles?

annotation_2.eng: Describe some pretty patterns around where you are.

annotation_3.eng: Find the rectangles in this picture and around where you are.

rows.annotation_1: There is a fun circular pattern on Chat's bed. Are there more blue circles or red circles?
rows.annotation_2: Describe some pretty patterns around where you are.
rows.annotation_3: Find the rectangles in this picture and around where you are.

rows.story_text: Daddy, mummy? asked Chat. She also called the names of her brothers and sisters. "Please, get me a flower." Everyone was surprised.

story_text.eng: Daddy, mummy? asked Chat. She also called the names of her brothers and sisters. "Please, get me a flower." Everyone was surprised.

annotation_2.eng: Why is everyone looking so happy?

annotation_3.eng: Can you count all the circles on her bed, or is it too many? Can you count other things, such as eyes, arms, or noses?

rows.annotation_2: Why is everyone looking so happy?
rows.annotation_3: Can you count all the circles on her bed, or is it too many? Can you count other things, such as eyes, arms, or noses?

rows.story_text:
Her sister returned with a flower.

Chat held it gently. "It is so lovely," she said.

story_text.eng:
Her sister returned with a flower.

Chat held it gently. "It is so lovely," she said.

annotation_1.eng: Imagine what it is like to see the world for the first time. What would you most want to see?

annotation_2.eng: Which side of her head did she hit on the rock and which side is bandaged? Hmmm ...?

annotation_3.eng: Can you find all the rectangles in this picture? Some of them are a bit sneaky.

rows.annotation_1: Imagine what it is like to see the world for the first time. What would you most want to see?
rows.annotation_2: Which side of her head did she hit on the rock and which side is bandaged? Hmmm ...?
rows.annotation_3: Can you find all the rectangles in this picture? Some of them are a bit sneaky.

rows.story_text:
Her family looked at one another.

"Chat, can you see the flower?" her mother asked.

story_text.eng:
Her family looked at one another.

"Chat, can you see the flower?" her mother asked.

annotation_1.eng: What emotion do you see on each person's face?

annotation_2.eng: Have you known anyone who suddenly got much better from an illness?

annotation_3.eng: Have you known anyone who was blind?

rows.annotation_1: What emotion do you see on each person's face?
rows.annotation_2: Have you known anyone who suddenly got much better from an illness?
rows.annotation_3: Have you known anyone who was blind?

rows.story_text:
Chat played with the flower in her hand.

"You are all so beautiful, just like this flower," she smiled.

story_text.eng:
Chat played with the flower in her hand.

"You are all so beautiful, just like this flower," she smiled.

annotation_1.eng: Point out some of the new rectangles in this picture.

annotation_2.eng: This is a very happy ending! Did you think the story would end this way?

annotation_3.eng: Some people become doctors because they like helping people to have happy endings like this.

rows.annotation_1: Point out some of the new rectangles in this picture.
rows.annotation_2: This is a very happy ending! Did you think the story would end this way?
rows.annotation_3: Some people become doctors because they like helping people to have happy endings like this.
